Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • Logger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Printable

    public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
implements Printable
    Taken from Derek Aguirre The Logger class will be used hold all operations involving logging user actions to a text file. Only require one instance of logger so it is made to be singleton.
    Since:
    10/10/2020
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Derek Aguirre
    See Also:
    RunBank

                       java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Taken from Derek Aguirre Will report on the file "Log.txt" that the currently logged in customer has deposited a specified amount of funds into their checking account.
        Parameters:

        accountFlag - Used to determine which account to retrieve information from
        moneyInput - The amount of money that the user is depositing
        initial - The initial amount of funds before the transaction

      • payLog

        public void payLog(Customer customerObject1,
                   Customer customerObject2,
                   java.lang.String accountFlag,
                   double initialBal1,
                   double initialBal2,
                   double payAmount)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Taken from Derek Aguirre

        Will report on the file "Log.txt" that the currently logged in customer has paid another customer a specified amount of funds.

        This transaction will be performed by utilizing both customer's checking accounts.

        Parameters:
        customerObject1 - An object of Customer, holds info stored about all of the first customer's accounts
        customerObject2 - An object of Customer, holds info stored about all of the second customer's accounts
        accountFlag - A string that determines which account the pay log will write information about
        initialBal1 - The initial amount of funds on the first customer's checking account before the transaction
        initialBal2 - The initial amount of funds on the second customer's checking account before the transaction
        payAmount - The specified amount of funds that has been transferred
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - InputOutputException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If file is not found
